metadata.name: CEV Generator #20
metadata.description:
Closed-eye hallucinations and closed-eye visualizations (CEV) are a distinct class of hallucination (technically a pseudohallucination since there is generally awareness that the perceived experience is not real). These types of hallucinations generally only occur when one's eyes are closed or when one is in a darkened room. They can be a form of phosphene. Some people report closed-eye hallucinations under the influence of psychedelics. (From Wikipedia.)

Huge thanks to Andrew Brereton (@aebrer) for getting me started on fxhash. None of this would be possible without his invaluable assistance.

Creator: N-LITE
Date: 2021-11-22
Twitter: @diskettepark
Website: linktr.ee/diskettepark
Platform: Pico-8, Lua

metadata.description:

No haste, no rush

Press [c] in live view to capture a 2048x2048 screenshot

Note: Can be GPU intensive. May not load on older device



XALTED 2022

metadata.name: Tumble Down Light Factory #260
metadata.description:
Tumble Down Light Factory is an interpretation of light installations & murals.

It attempts to trigger the feeling of coming up on a new block in a new city to discover an unexpected piece of art that is stories tall or entering a new room, knowing there will be a projection dominating the space with its light and color.

This is an abstract distillation of those things and those feelings.

Each composition is initially drawn to a hidden ‚Äútemplate‚Äù canvas which is sampled and then rendered on the main canvas in various ways after applying some transforms to give it some depth (and so you can actually see it.)

Viewing in full-screen is nice. You should try it.

T : Save hidden ‚Äòtemplate‚Äô image
S : Save current resolution
1 -> 5 : Save low -> high resolution

metadata.name: Unicorn #2058
metadata.description:
All of us have dreams, and everyone would like to meet a fairy, a genie, a wizard, or someone else who will make our dreams come true in a snap of a finger or with the wave of a wand. But we're the only ones who can do it. We are those magical unicorns, unique, inimitable, with our own qualities and magical abilities.
These unicorns are the visualization of our inner selves that makes our dreams come true. An embodiment of all the best with a huge positive magical power.

Twitter: @unicorn_nft_art
Web: https://unicorn-nft.web.app/

by @lucky26puch, @AgataBaranova17
Made in 2022

License: CC BY-NC 4.0

metadata.name: Vers #46
metadata.description:
Vers

A flexibility in regards to position.

V : Switch the top to the bottom or vice versa
A : Toggle reveal animation/title card
S : Save current resolution
1 -> 5 : Save low -> high resolution

metadata.name: Annum #5289
metadata.description:
This project is being released in celebration of the 1 year aniversary of Achromat, my first release on fxhash. In addition to being inspired by Achromat, aspects of other previous projects have been incorporated. My deepest gratitude to all who have collected my work over the past year.

In live mode, add &size=<YOUR_PIXEL_SIZE> to change the pixel size of the image for export (Right click to save). For example, &size=4000 will set the width of the image to be 4000 pixels.

50% of primary sales go to Savepakistan.

metadata.name: CHX-1 #170
metadata.description:
Glitching pixels like it‚Äôs 1999.

Inspired by 90‚Äôs digital aesthetics, CHX-1 takes a random selection of GAN seeds, combines them in unique ways, and processes them ‚Äìindividually and as a group‚Äì with a series of glitching dithering algorithms. Generating fun, original, colorful artworks. Millions of possibilities. Have fun!

<<< Base seeds generated offline using personal styleGAN2-ADA models. Image processing and combinations done generatively by the CHX-1 algorithm >>>

GAN ‚Äì> p5js ‚Äì> Blockchain


‚Ä¢ Artworks can take a few seconds to load when running live code.

‚Ä¢ Press ‚Äús‚Äù (when "open live" is active) to save a PNG image.


Copyright (¬©) 2022 Thomas Noya
Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

‚óâ_‚óâ

metadata.name: A Bugged Forest #190
metadata.description:
A forest has stories to tell.
About times that were, about times that will be.
-
This project was minted in much unusual conditions. 
We gathered here, by 38 degrees heat. We belong to a crowd who loves stories, of civilisations at stake and deities, of afterlife and worship. We drank and hugged and chanted pagan hymns. We minted the Bugged Forest from our place on earth that we call Hell just for the fun of it. We are passionate, and loving, and angry and desperate. We, people of the soil, under a bugged sun.
-
This project is the long-form version of an algorithm that contains a bug. ‚ÄúThe Bugged Tree‚Äù‚Äôs code was salvaged and stored and served as the core motivation and engine for an entire forest. Its concept is about releasing the control. I am a  byproduct of evolution, an iteration of that specie who wanted utter control, and which at some point, lost control over its own creation. As a generative artist, I chose to welcome the event of chance into my creative process. The symbolism in chance made me feel humble and free. Unwilling to make any change to a story that the Tree needed to tell me, as a listener, rather than a writer of my own idealised fantasies.
-
The iterations aren‚Äôt under control. They may be odd and off. We have to accept it. They are also plottable, press [s] in live mode to get a SVG. Attempt the plot at your own risk, as there‚Äôs a possibility for it to come near to impossibilities or cause paper or motor damage, and most certainly, a bugged drawing.
-
From Earth or from Hell, with love, yours truthfully, NFTBiker and zancan

metadata.name: Action; System #8
metadata.description:
Action; system is an experimental study inspired by the work of Fran√ßois Morellet. Morellet was one of the founders of the Groupe de Recherche d'Art Visuel (GRAV), founded in the 60s. His work was often informed by systems, a set of rules that determine the artwork, reducing the artist's subjectivity to a minimum.

This work explores what happens when we let go of the strict rule set. Do we ever fully let go?

-----------------
This work was released for the 2023 fundraising exhibition Cure3, and all of the proceeds and 1% of royalties will go to Parkinson's research funds. You can find more information at https://cure3.co.uk/.

-----------------
Controls
- R: new randomized output (the chances of recovering one of these outputs are very slim, that's what the next control is for)
- E: high-res output
- Double click: fullscreen

While you see the eye of Horus, your artwork is loading.

------------------
Made with p5.js & glsl
License: CC BY-NC-ND 4.0

metadata.name: Make-believe #4
metadata.description:
#genuary32nd ‚Äì Let's meet on this make-believe date, in this make-believe place.
I‚Äôm having d√©j√† vu, or is it a memory?

This artwork is originally created for the genuary2023 prompt "Art Deco", using the same core algorithm as Memory Module. Made with fractal math and p5js.

Keyboard controls:
[s] Save the current view in live mode.
[1] to [8] Change resolution, 1.5K to 12K.
[g] Toggle texture.

URL params:
&aspect=[aspect ratio, eg 2]
&res=[resolution multiplier, 0.5-8]

Created by Elsif, 2023.02

metadata.name: MindFlow #252
metadata.description:
Consciousness flows over our mind, just like Karma goes through our body, which creates our life.

--------------------

This is an abstract generation made by pure code.

--------------------

In live mode, press 's' or 'S' to save a high resolution png (3000*4500).

Please be patient with drawing process and have fun with its tiny logo animation.
I hope you like this work and enjoy exploring your own mindflow.

Endlessworld 2022

metadata.name: Tetragons #286
metadata.description:
It all starts with a simple dot. If we enlarge it, we realize that it is in fact a square, and that we can assemble several of them, evenly spaced, to build a grid. This grid can be used as a basis for stacking a more or less large set of tetragons, and they combine with each other to form polygons, enhanced by a minimalist palette of colors, inspired by the work of Mondrian. The key to this orderly world is the use of the right angle.

Thus, everything has its place, and a place exists for everything.

---

You can download various versions of this artwork :

- press "p" to download a PNG at the current resolution of your browser
- press "h" to download a high-resolution PNG (8K) suitable for print
- press "s" to download an SVG version that you can then use to generate any image size

---

Coded with care, and with the help of p5.js, p5.js-svg and polybooljs libraries.
Consider any bug that you could get in your edition as a blessing from the RNG Gods !

metadata.name: pico_punk_generator_generator.p8 #97
metadata.description:
Welcome to the ultimate pico_punk generator! This interactive token is a parameter based generator that creates unique pico_punk generators. Each one will generate one pico_punk with a number of layers chosen by you during the parameter selection phase. Additionally, you can use the buttons to navigate the generative space, and create your own pico_punks via an interactive process of discovery. This is the final pico_punk generator I intend to make, with the extra capabilities added by the parameter selection process, and the final tweaks and changes I made to the appearances and effects, I think this project is now as complete as I can ever make it.

The controls:
- arrow keys: move through the generative space... each step adds one layer to the composition
- x button: take a screenshot of the generated pico_punk
- o button: clear all layers except the current one (clean slate for building a new pico_punk)

Each layer has a chance to apply one of various visual effects, which vary in how transformative (or disruptive) they are.


pico_punks began as a project to create something akin to DOS Punks, but fully generative, without any manual intervention or pre-rendered components, using only the Pico-8 Fantasy Console. You can find the first generator here: (https://objkt.com/asset/hicetnunc/439049). In this early version, the generator was interactive, but each pico_punk was totally isolated, being generated from one unique seed and one consistent process. Over time, this evolved to this final experience: one in which the "curator", the user exploring the generator, is not just choosing from an infinite number of punks, but actually the process of exploration itself is modifying the output before your eyes.

pico_punks is all about exploring themes of irreversibility, noise, pattern recognition, pareidolia, and of course identity. What began for me as something bordering on satire, has become an integral part of how I represent myself online. It is my sincere wish that with these tools you are also able to create something unique that you feel represents you, and is something that couldn't have been made without you.

Thank you so much for these last couple years of support, and here's to many more making and collecting art together :)


Notes on minting: 
- 30% of royalties go to the minter
- 10% of royalties go to previous curated pico_punk holders
- One reserve spot is generated for each curated pico_punk held, and they stack
- One extra reserve spot is for my Mom

metadata.name: vapour trails #50
metadata.description:
‚Äúfirst you look so strong, then you fade away
the sun will blind my eyes, i‚Äôll love you anyway
thirsty for your smile, i watch you for a while
you are a vapour trail in a deep blue sky‚Äù

‚Äî Andy Bell (Ride) (1991)

this collection tries to capture that feeling of lying in the grass
in a park
staring at the sky
fantasizing about your love (if they even exist)
playing out different paths
while smoke from your cigarette (jazz or otherwise)
trails between you and the faraway of everything
feeling grateful to not have to be anywhere
but here (now)

with luck
they lay next to you
and silently you appreciate each tick of the clock
wasted together
until life again gets in the way
and pulls you back
into the fray

[ live view commands ]
[ M : toggle matte ]
[ S : save current size ]
[ 1 : save 2000x3000 png ]
[ 2 : save 4000x6000 png ]
[ 3 : save 6000x9000* png ]
[ 4 : save 8000x12000* png ]
[ 5 : save 10000x15000* png ]

* higher resolutions can take a while to render.

twitter: @heyjeres

xoxo

metadata.name: emit #9
metadata.description:
the things we choose 
to consume 
and seek become 
part of us 
they radiate 
from us tangled 
in loops 
drawn to the center
and held close 
or scattered about 
as chaos 
overwhelms
almost always
regardless of shape 
or intent
we emit what we absorb
for better
we hope

[ live view save keys ]
[ S : current size ]
[ 1 : 3000x2000 ]
[ 2 : 6000x4000 ]
[ 3 : 9000x6000* ]
[ 4 : 12000x8000* ]
[ 5 : 15000x10000* ]

* higher resolutions can take a while to render.

twitter: @heyjeres

metadata.name: Coronado #347
metadata.description:
This series is about the beauty and charm of imperfection, chaos amidst order, and letting go. It's about knowing that however much control we think we may have, things can all fall apart or burst into something unexpectedly wonderful at any moment, even without our hands tightly on the reigns.

Please see fxtext article linked from main project page for more background on the project and rendering notes.

Some key commands in live mode:

G : Toggle grain
S : Save current resolution
1 : 4000x5000
2 : 6000x7500
3 : 8000x10000
4 : 10000x12500
5 : 12000x15000
6 : 14000x17500
(1-6 work best on Chrome)
(rendering takes longer as resolution increases)
